alert.note: Alert for Banks; Hall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:09PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Banks and northeastern Hall Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 509 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Mount Airy, or 9 miles southeast of Clarkesville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Homer, Lula, Pinefield Crossroads and Hollingsworth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
